item.title: How To Watch Ole Miss Rebels Women’s Basketball in 2025
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
Don't miss a single Ole Miss game. Our viewing guide has the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule and every channel you need to watch Ole Miss women's basketball.

The post How To Watch Ole Miss Rebels Women’s Basketball in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Junior Sports Writer Alex Vejar, who has covered sports for more than 10 years.

A closer look at Ole Miss women’s basketball

Watching Ole Miss women’s basketball last season must’ve been a tad frustrating, given the team finishing third in the SEC the season before. But even though the overall record wasn’t as good, the Rebels still made the Sweet 16.

Heading into the 2025–2026 season, Ole Miss is projected to earn a bid to the NCAA Tournament for the fifth consecutive season. The team lost some scoring punch, but Ohio State transfer Cotie McMahon and returning sophomore Sira Thienou will look to step into big roles.

I know you’ll want to watch every Rebels game imaginable in 2025–2026. That’s why I created this guide you’re about to read. My goal is to break down exactly how to watch Ole Miss women’s basketball on TV during the entire season.

2025–2026 Ole Miss women’s basketball TV schedule

The 50th season of Ole Miss Women’s Basketball tips off with a “Kids Day” game on November 3, against Norfolk State. The non-conference schedule includes a trip to Daytona Beach over Thanksgiving against Wisconsin, and a massive home matchup on December 4 against Notre Dame as part of the ACC/SEC Challenge.

SEC play begins at home on New Year’s Day against Georgia. Circle Sunday, January 11, when rival Mississippi State comes to town for a huge clash. The Rebels will aim for a strong finish before the SEC Tournament returns to Greenville, SC, from March 4–8.

Here is a look at the full 2025–2026 Ole Miss women’s basketball schedule.

Opponent Day Time (ET) Channel
Norfolk State Spartans Monday, Nov. 3 12:00 p.m. SEC Network
At Alabama A&M Bulldogs Friday, Nov. 7 8:00 p.m. TBA
Southern Jaguars Wednesday, Nov. 12 7:00 p.m. SECN+
At Memphis Tigers Tuesday, Nov. 18 8:00 p.m. ESPN+
Longwood Lancers Monday, Nov. 24 7:00 p.m. SECN+

George Mason Patriots Saturday, Nov. 29 4:00 p.m. TBA

Kansas State Sunday, Dec. 7 3:00 p.m. TBA
Wofford Terriers Saturday, Dec. 13 1:00 p.m. SECN+
South Carolina State Lady Bulldogs Sunday, Dec. 14 3:00 p.m. SECN+
Mississippi Valley State Devilettes Wednesday, Dec. 17 7:00 p.m. SECN+
Old Dominion Monarchs Sunday, Dec. 21 TBD TBA
Alcorn State Lady Braves Sunday, Dec. 28 3:00 p.m. SECN+
Georgia Lady Bulldogs Thursday, Jan. 1 TBD TBA
At Texas (#4) Sunday, Jan. 4 3:00 p.m. TBA
At Oklahoma (#6) Thursday, Jan. 8 7:00 p.m. TBA
Mississippi State Bulldogs Sunday, Jan. 11 6:00 p.m. SEC Network
At Georgia Lady Bulldogs Sunday, Jan. 18 12:00 p.m. SEC Network
At Missouri Tigers Thursday, Jan. 22 TBD TBA

Auburn Tigers Sunday, Feb. 1 TBD TBA
At Alabama Crimson Tide Thursday, Feb. 5 9:00 p.m. SEC Network
Arkansas Razorbacks Thursday, Feb. 12 9:00 p.m. SEC Network
At Kentucky Wildcats (#24) Sunday, Feb. 15 2:00 p.m. SEC Network
LSU (#5) Thursday, Feb. 19 9:00 p.m. ESPN
At South Carolina (#2) Sunday, Feb. 22 12:00 p.m. TBA
At Florida Gators Thursday, Feb. 26 6:00 p.m. SEC Network
Texas A&M Aggies Sunday, March 1 3:00 p.m. TBA

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching Ole Miss women’s basketball

Following the Rebels in the SEC means relying heavily on the ESPN family of networks. The main linear channel is the SEC Network (SECN), which airs numerous conference games and requires a subscription via a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming provider. Marquee games might also appear on ESPN or ESPN2.

A big chuck of the schedule streams on SEC Network+, which is not a standalone channel or subscription. It’s a digital platform within the ESPN app that streams games not shown on the main SEC Network.

In light of that, my top recommendation is ESPN Unlimited. At $29.99/mo., it’s much cheaper than a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming service. But if you already have DIRECTV, Hulu + Live TV, Fubo, Spectrum, or Verizon Fios, you already have access to ESPN Unlimited. You just have to sign in to the ESPN app with your TV credentials.

I must say that there are Ole Miss two games in late November that will broadcast on BallerTV, a steaming platform that airs amateur an youth sports. The platform does not offer a free trial, but it does allow you to stream select games for free.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch Ole Miss women’s basketball FAQ

Where can I watch Ole Miss women's basketball for free?

Free viewing options are extremely limited for SEC teams. Unlike conferences with broadcast partners like FOX or ABC for regular-season games, nearly all Ole Miss games require a subscription that includes the ESPN, SEC Network, or potentially ESPN+. Major tournament finals might air on ABC/ESPN, but regular-season freebies are rare.

How can I stream Ole Miss basketball without cable?

The best way is through ESPN Unlimited, either on its own or through a TV provider. DIRECTV, Hulu + Live TV, Fubo, Spectrum, and Verizon Fios all offer ESPN Unlimited by logging in to the ESPN app with your provider credentials.

Do I need SEC Network+ to watch Ole Miss women's basketball?

Yes, SEC Network+ (available through the ESPN App with a qualifying provider login) is required. This streams all SEC games that are not shown on the main linear SEC Network, including many early-season and non-conference matchups.

How can I stream Ole Miss women's basketball out of state?

If you are out of state, ESPN Unlimited is a great option as it carries every ESPN-owned channel, including SEC Network and SEC Network+. You can subscribe that service on its own or through DIRECTV, Hulu + Live TV, Fubo, Spectrum, and Verizon Fios.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com editorial team cross-referenced the official Ole Miss women’s basketball schedule with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Using those details, we selected our viewing recommendations based on channel availability, pricing, and ease of use.

This guide is updated regularly throughout the season to ensure our information is accurate. To learn more about our methods, check out our How We Rank page.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch Vanderbilt Commodores Women’s Basketball in 2025
item.dc:creator: CableTV.com Staff
item.description:
Anchor down! Here's how you can watch every Vanderbilt women's basketball game this season. Get the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule and best streaming packages.

The post How To Watch Vanderbilt Commodores Women’s Basketball in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
✦ Edited and fact-checked by Sports Editor Taylor Kujawa, our resident TV expert with over eight years of covering sports.

A closer look at Vanderbilt women’s basketball

Vanderbilt women’s basketball has successfully re-established itself as an annual NCAA Tournament team. Under head coach Shea Ralph, the Commodores have made back-to-back March Madness appearances for the first time since 2014, proving the new foundation is solid. But after a 22–11 season ended with a first-round exit to Oregon, it’s clear Vanderbilt must kick things up a notch this campaign.

This is now unequivocally sophomore star Mikayla Blakes’ team. She’s joined by high-impact transfers Ndjakalenga Mwenentanda (from Texas) and Aalyah Del Rosario (from LSU). But I’m also keeping a close eye on senior Sacha Washington and junior Aiyana Mitchell to help this roster gel and make a bigger impact during SEC play.

Finding the Commodores on TV requires navigating a complex schedule split across ESPN channels, including SEC Network and SEC Network+ (SECN+). To help you follow every step of their journey, I’ve created this complete guide on how to watch Vanderbilt women’s basketball this season.

2025–2026 Vanderbilt women’s basketball TV schedule

The Commodores tip off the 2025–2026 season in style on November 3 in Paris, France, with a marquee matchup against California on ESPNU. Vanderbilt’s home opener follows on November 10 against Furman. Overall, the non-conference schedule comes packed with tough tests, including the ACC/SEC Challenge against Virginia (Dec. 3) and a neutral-site game against Michigan (Jan. 19).

The team’s SEC slate begins on New Year’s Day at Arkansas, but the date I have circled in red is March 1. That’s the regular-season finale, and a massive rivalry clash on the road against Tennessee, which will air on ESPN.

To help you follow along, I’ve laid out the complete 2025–2026 Vanderbilt women’s basketball schedule below. I’ll be keeping it updated with all the latest tip-off times and broadcast information.

Opponent Day Time (ET) Channel
California Golden Bears Monday, Nov. 3 2:30 p.m. ESPNU
Furman Paladins Monday, Nov. 10 7:00 p.m. SEC Network
At Austin Peay Governors Wednesday, Nov. 12 7:00 p.m. ESPN+
At Western Kentucky Lady Toppers Wednesday, Nov. 19 7:30 p.m. ESPN+
Alabama State Lady Hornets Friday, Nov. 21 12:00 p.m. SECN+
Tennessee State Lady Tigers Sunday, Nov. 23 3:00 p.m. SECN+
Oregon State Beavers Thursday, Nov. 27 8:00 p.m. TBA
Virginia Cavaliers Wednesday, Dec. 3 5:00 p.m. SEC Network
South Florida Bulls Monday, Dec. 15 7:30 p.m. SECN+
UAlbany Great Danes Thursday, Dec. 18 7:30 p.m. SECN+
Texas Southern Tigers Saturday, Dec. 20 1:00 p.m. SECN+
Stonehill Skyhawks Sunday, Dec. 28 3:00 p.m. SECN+

LSU (#5) Sunday, Jan. 4 5:00 p.m. ESPN
Missouri Tigers Thursday, Jan. 8 TBD TBA
At Texas A&M Aggies Sunday, Jan. 11 3:00 p.m. TBA
At Mississippi State Bulldogs Thursday, Jan. 15 6:30 p.m. SEC Network
Michigan (#13) Monday, Jan. 19 2:30 p.m. TBA
Auburn Tigers Thursday, Jan. 22 TBD TBA
At South Carolina (#2) Sunday, Jan. 25 3:00 p.m. ESPN
At Ole Miss (#12) Thursday, Jan. 29 TBD TBA
Florida Gators Sunday, Feb. 1 4:00 p.m. SEC Network
At Kentucky Wildcats (#24) Thursday, Feb. 5 TBD TBA
Oklahoma (#6) Monday, Feb. 9 9:00 p.m. ESPN2
Texas (#4) Thursday, Feb. 12 TBD TBA
At Georgia Lady Bulldogs Sunday, Feb. 15 12:00 p.m. SEC Network
Kentucky Wildcats (#24) Sunday, Feb. 22 TBD TBA
Alabama Crimson Tide Thursday, Feb. 26 TBD TBA
At Tennessee (#8) Sunday, March 1 2:00 p.m. ESPN

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching Vanderbilt women’s basketball

To follow the Commodores this season, your TV plan must be built around the ESPN family of networks. You’ll need the main ESPN channels, SEC Network (which also unlocks all the SECN+ streams), ESPN+, and FOX (for one marquee game). To make it simple, I’ve broken down my top recommendations for a couple of different types of fans.

For the simplest, all-in-one package, my top recommendation is a robust live TV streaming service like Hulu + Live TV or Stream with DIRECTV. Both of these carry all those essential ESPN/SEC channels and your local FOX affiliate, so you’re completely covered for the entire season with one subscription.

If you don’t want a full (and expensive) live TV plan, a more cost-effective route is ESPN Unlimited, which gets you all the ESPN and SEC Network content. To get the FOX games, you can either get the ESPN Unlimited and FOX One bundle for total coverage or use a digital antenna to pick up your local FOX station.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch Vanderbilt women’s basketball FAQ

Where can I watch Vanderbilt women's basketball for free?

Your best free option is a digital antenna, which will get you any marquee Vanderbilt games on local channels like ABC or FOX (including the Jan. 19 matchup against Michigan). For games on cable channels like SEC Network, you can use a live TV streaming free trial from a service like DIRECTV or Fubo.

How can I stream Vanderbilt basketball without cable?

You can watch Vanderbilt basketball without cable using a few great options. A comprehensive live TV streaming service like Hulu + Live TV will bundle all the key channels (like SEC Network and ESPN) into one plan. A more focused and cheaper option is the new ESPN Unlimited subscription, which gives you access to all the games that air on the ESPN family of networks.

Can I watch Vanderbilt basketball on ESPN+?

Yes, ESPN+ streams some Vanderbilt games. But it's important to note that ESPN+ is now available with an ESPN Select or ESPN Unlimited subscription. Also, some live TV providers offer complimentary ESPN Unlimited access, so you might already have ESPN+ coverage depending on your TV plan.

How can I stream Vanderbilt women's basketball out of state?

Out-of-state Vanderbilt fans don't need to worry about blackout restrictions, as all games are available nationwide. You just need the right TV service for ESPN and SEC Network channel access, like Hulu + Live TV or DIRECTV. These services allow you to log into the ESPN app for all SECN+ games.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com editorial team cross-referenced the official Vanderbilt women’s basketball schedule with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Using those details, we selected our viewing recommendations based on channel availability, pricing, and ease of use.

This guide is updated regularly throughout the season to ensure our information is accurate. To learn more about our methods, check out our How We Rank page.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch Alabama Football
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Roll Tide! Check out our college football schedule guide for the Alabama Crimson Tide.

The post How To Watch Alabama Football appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free with Fubo

Alabama fans, close out of those message boards and stop waiting for the Finebaum call-in line: CableTV.com’s here for you after a rough year.

Everyone anticipated some growing pains during Kalen DeBoer’s first season in Tuscaloosa, but missing the College Football Playoff? Dropping four games with sloppy defensive play? Losing to Vanderbilt?!

But for as rocky as things got last year, don’t throw out your jersey and flash back to the Mike Shula era just yet. This offseason, Alabama reeled in yet another top-five recruiting class and reunited with new offensive coordinator Ryan Grubb, who guided DeBoer’s 2023 Washington Huskies squad to the national championship game. (And of course, having players like receiver Ryan Williams ensures that Alabama’s floor remains safely high.)

Can Alabama bounce back after a tough year and return to the postseason? Here’s what you need to know if you want to watch Alabama football on TV this season.

Jump to:

  • Watch Alabama vs. Florida State
  • Alabama football TV schedule
  • Watch Alabama football live

How can I watch the Alabama game today?

Alabama kicks off the 2025 season against Florida State on Saturday, August 30, at 2:30 p.m. CT on ABC.

Check out our How To Watch College Football guide and college football schedule preview column to learn how to watch college football on TV today. Want to watch Alabama football on TV? Enter your zip code below to see providers in your area.

Alabama football TV schedule 2025

Alabama’s non-conference slate should give the Crimson Tide ample opportunities to work out some kinks. Despite Week 1’s disastrous loss to Florida State, the Tide should still be favored in tune-up games against Louisiana-Monroe and Wisconsin.

But Kalen DeBoer’s squad will have its work cut out for it in SEC conference play. Alabama will open against Georgia before facing a slate of dangerous teams like Vanderbilt, South Carolina, and LSU that are more than capable of getting a win against the Crimson Tide. Alabama’s strength of schedule ranks all the way at 11th, per ESPN’s Bill Connelly.

Check back every week for up-to-date broadcast times and TV channels for every Alabama Crimson Tide football game.

Opponent Day Time (ET)/Result Channel
At Florida State Seminoles Saturday, Aug. 30 L 17–31 ABC
UL Monroe Warhawks Saturday, Sept. 6 W 73–0 SEC Network
Wisconsin Badgers Saturday, Sept. 13 W 38–14 ABC
At Georgia Bulldogs (#5) Saturday, Sept. 27 W 24–21 ABC
Vanderbilt Commodores (#16) Saturday, Oct. 4 W 30–14 ABC
At Missouri Tigers (#14) Saturday, Oct. 11 W 27–24 ABC
Tennessee Volunteers (#11) Saturday, Oct. 18 W 37–20 ABC
At South Carolina Gamecocks Saturday, Oct. 25 W 29–22 ABC
LSU Tigers Saturday, Nov. 8 7:30 p.m. ABC
Oklahoma Sooners (#11) Saturday, Nov. 15 TBD TBA
Eastern Illinois Panthers Saturday, Nov. 22 2:00 p.m. TBA
At Auburn Tigers Saturday, Nov. 29 TBD TBA

Data effective as of post date. All listed rankings are from the AP Top 25 poll at the time of the matchup.

Roll Tide with Homefield’s Alabama apparel collection, which highlights Bear Bryant’s 1978 and 1979 championship-winning teams, vintage script Alabama logos, and Big Al variants from Alabama’s back catalog.

Many live TV streaming services offer free trials if you’re on the road and need a quick way to catch this weekend’s Alabama football game. Check out our guide to streaming service free trials to learn more.

Prefer to watch the Alabama game for free? You can’t get ESPN with an antenna, but if you’re preparing for next season, we’d recommend the Mohu Leaf Supreme Pro, which is an over-the-air (OTA) antenna that hooks up to your TV. With an OTA antenna, you’ll get major networks like ABC, CBS, and FOX and be able to watch Alabama football without paying for a cable TV subscription. Watch Alabama football FAQ

What time does Alabama play today?

Alabama opens the 2025 college football season against Florida State at 2:30 p.m. CT.

What is SEC Network+?

SEC Network+ is a section on the ESPN app that highlights streaming-exclusive SEC football exclusives.

What channel is the Alabama game on?

ABC will be the channel for the Alabama Crimson Tide college football season opener.

Who does Alabama play today?

Alabama will play Florida State at 2:30 p.m. CT on Saturday, August 30.

Where can I watch the Alabama game today?

Alabama will play Florida State on ABC to kick off the 2025 college football season. You can watch every Alabama game with a cable TV plan or a live-streaming TV service like Fubo, Hulu + Live, or YouTube TV.

What is the best streaming app for Alabama football?

We recommend watching Alabama football games with Fubo. The streaming service offers flexible quad-view settings, carries every channel with Alabama games, and includes a free trial.

Why you should trust us

For our schedule guides, our college football experts carefully track each school’s broadcast partners every week during the regular season. When they announce gametimes and channel assignments, you’ll get that information here first.

Additionally, we drew from our existing streaming TV research and hands-on testing to determine the best ways to watch college football. For the 2025–2026 season, we reexamined the most popular TV providers head-to-head and formed our recommendations based on channel lineups, pricing, and ease of use.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch BYU Cougars Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
How far can the BYU Cougars football team go without Jake Retzlaff at QB? Our detailed guide will help Cougar Nation watch every Cougars game in 2025.

The post How To Watch BYU Cougars Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

BYU star quarterback Jake Retzlaff was accused of sexual assault, faced a seven-game suspension from the religious school for violating its honor code, withdrew from the school, and is reportedly headed to Tulane. So what’s next for the Cougars?

BYU football made waves in its first year in the Big 12 Conference last season, going 11–2 overall and 7–2 in conference play. Without Retzlaff this season, the Cougars have big question marks about their offense, although they do have running back L.J. Martin and wide receiver Chase Roberts returning.

Will the Cougars be a surprise again in Year 2 of the Big 12, or will they take a gigantic step back? Read my comprehensive watch guide to learn how to keep tabs on BYU football in 2025.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 BYU Cougars TV schedule

Fans of the Cougars who can’t make it to LaVell Edwards Stadium are sure to be tuned in for the Holy War matchup against the University of Utah on Saturday, Oct. 18. The rest of the schedule, though, will be interesting.

ESPN ranked BYU’s strength of schedule at just 74th in the country—meaning prognosticators think the Cougars will have an easy go of it in 2025. But that’s why you play the games, as they say.

Find out how to catch every one of those games below.

Opponent Day Time (ET)/Result Channel
Portland State Vikings Saturday, Aug. 30 W 69–0 ESPN+
Stanford Cardinal Saturday, Sept. 6 W 27–3 ESPN
At East Carolina Pirates Saturday, Sept. 20 W 34–13 ESPN2
At Colorado Buffaloes Saturday, Sept. 27 W 24–21 ESPN
West Virginia Mountaineers Friday, Oct. 3 W 38–24 ESPN
At Arizona Wildcats Saturday, Oct. 11 W 33–27 ESPN2
Utah Utes (#23) Saturday, Oct. 18 W 24–21 FOX
At Iowa State Cyclones Saturday, Oct. 25 W 41–27 FOX
At Texas Tech Red Raiders (#9) Saturday, Nov. 8 12:00 p.m. ABC
TCU Horned Frogs Saturday, Nov. 15 TBD TBA
At Cincinnati Bearcats (#25) Saturday, Nov. 22 TBD TBA
UCF Knights Saturday, Nov. 29 TBD TBA

Data effective as of post date. All listed rankings are from the AP Top 25 poll at the time of the matchup.

Best TV plans for watching BYU Cougars football

Hulu + Live TV

Price:

Channels:

View Plans for Hulu

For die-hard BYU Cougars football fans, ensuring you never miss a game is a top priority. Hulu + Live TV is my favorite choice for watching the most college football action because of its comprehensive channel lineup. It also includes worthy perks like ESPN+ at no extra charge and unlimited DVR storage.

While Hulu + Live TV offers extensive college sports, it doesn’t feature every football matchup, particularly those involving lower-level teams. Some games may require access to a regional sports network or a separate streaming subscription.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch BYU Cougars football FAQ

Where can I watch the BYU Cougars for free?

You can stream many BYU Cougars football games with a DIRECTV free trial, but be aware of local blackouts and games exclusive to other platforms. You can also watch any games airing on your local ABC, CBS, FOX, or NBC station for free with a simple digital antenna.

Where can I stream BYU Cougars football games if I don’t have cable?

My favorite way to watch the BYU Cougars without cable is through Hulu + Live TV. The streaming service has every core college football channel, including ESPN+. But you may still need a separate subscription for games exclusive to Peacock (for Big Ten games) or FloFootball (for smaller conferences).

Can I watch BYU Cougars football on ESPN+?

Yes, you can watch select BYU Cougars football games on ESPN+. At the time of publication, at least one matchup involving the Cougars will appear on ESPN+ during the 2025 season. That game is Saturday, Aug. 30, against Portland State at 8:00 p.m. ET.

How do I watch BYU Cougars football if I live out of state?

For out-of-state fans, most BYU Cougars games air nationally, so a good live TV streaming service will have you covered. Of course, some college football matchups have unique broadcast rights. That’s why it’s always best to check my TV schedule above for specific channel information.

Why you should trust us

Alex, the junior sports writer at CableTV.com, cross-referenced the official BYU Cougars football schedule with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Using those details, he selected his viewing recommendations based on channel availability, pricing, and ease of use.

Alex will update this guide regularly throughout the season to ensure the information is accurate. To learn more about our methods, check out our How We Rank page.

item.title: How To Watch Army Black Knights Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
On, brave old Army team! Our Army football viewing guide features the complete 2025 TV schedule, plus channel listings and streaming recommendations.

The post How To Watch Army Black Knights Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Under 12th-year head coach Jeff Monken, the Army Black Knights have a clear identity: disciplined, hard-nosed football. That tradition will once again be on display at historic Michie Stadium, on the grounds of the United States Military Academy, creating an atmosphere unlike any other in college football.

Now in their second year in the American Conference, the Black Knights must battle through a tough conference schedule peppered with high-profile non-conference games. Every regular-season game serves as preparation for the season-defining matchups against their service academy rivals.

Navigating Army’s broadcast schedule can be tricky, with games split across ESPN, CBS Sports, and other channels. But I’m here to help. Below, I’ve laid out the complete 2025 TV schedule and my expert pick for the best streaming service to ensure you don’t miss a snap.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Army football TV schedule

Army football kicks off its 2025 campaign on August 29, looking to build on its inaugural season in the American Conference. This brings another full slate of conference rivals and a diverse broadcast calendar for fans, with games airing across ESPN and CBS Sports platforms throughout the year.

Even with a full conference slate, Army’s primary objective is timeless: capturing the Commander-in-Chief’s Trophy. The season builds toward the crucial matchups with Air Force and Navy that culminate in the unparalleled pageantry of the Army–Navy Game in December.

Check out the complete Army football broadcast schedule in the table below, complete with kick-off times and channel listings.

Opponent Day Time (ET)/Result Channel
Tarleton State Texans Friday, Aug. 29 L 27–30 CBS Sports Network
At Kansas State Wildcats Saturday, Sept. 6 W 24–21 ESPN
North Texas Mean Green Saturday, Sept. 20 L 38–45 CBS Sports Network
At East Carolina Pirates Thursday, Sept. 25 L 6–28 ESPN

item.title: How To Watch Florida State Seminoles Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Go Noles! Here’s how to watch Florida State football this season. Our guide has the complete 2025 TV schedule, channel listings, and top streaming options.

The post How To Watch Florida State Seminoles Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Few teams in college football have a wider range of possibilities heading into the 2025 season than the Florida State Seminoles. After a near-perfect 13–1 campaign in 2023, the program took a historic downturn, finishing last season with an abysmal 2–10 record. The dramatic swing has left fans and rivals alike wondering which version of the team will show up this fall.

The task of orchestrating a rebound falls to head coach Mike Norvell, now in his sixth year. The journey back to national relevance for Florida State University will be waged in the competitive Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC). It all begins in front of the passionate home crowd at Doak Campbell Stadium on August 30 vs. Alabama (woof, what a draw).

For the faithful who want to watch Florida State football through every high and low this year, most games will be broadcast across the ESPN family of networks. The ACC Network will be a crucial channel for any fan, with other key matchups airing on ABC and ESPN. Keep reading as I outline the complete TV schedule and cover which streaming service is ideal for watching every snap this season.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Florida State football TV schedule

There are no easy weeks on the 2025 Florida State football schedule. The season kicks off with that monumental non-conference game against Alabama and is packed with high-stakes rivalry matchups against Miami and Clemson.

This gauntlet of high-profile opponents will test Florida State’s resilience from start to finish. You can follow along with the complete TV schedule below, featuring updated channel listings and kickoff times.

Where can I watch the Florida State Seminoles for free?

Where can I stream Florida State football games if I don’t have cable?

My favorite way to watch the Florida State Seminoles without cable is through Hulu + Live TV. The streaming service has every core college football channel, including ESPN+. Yes, some Florida State football games stream on ESPN+. But it can be pretty hit or miss. During the 2024 season, only one non-conference game involving the Seminoles appeared on ESPN+.

item.title: How To Watch Nebraska Cornhuskers Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Go Big Red! Find out how to watch Nebraska Cornhuskers football with our viewing guide, featuring the complete 2025 TV schedule and our top streaming picks.

The post How To Watch Nebraska Cornhuskers Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

For the first time in what feels like a generation, there’s a real sense of momentum building in Lincoln. Last season, head coach Matt Rhule’s rebuild finally started paying off as the Nebraska Cornhuskers snapped their nearly decade-long bowl drought and got back in the AP Poll.

Now, the big question for Year 3 of the Rhule era is simple: Can they turn that momentum into a real climb up the Big Ten standings? All eyes will be on young quarterback Dylan Raiola to see if he can live up to the hype and lead the offense to the next level.

The great news for the Sea of Red is that you can follow that story from anywhere. As a Big Ten member, Nebraska’s games are national events, featured across TV partners like CBS Sports, FOX Sports, and NBC Sports, including Big Ten Network and Peacock. To help you navigate it all, I’ve laid out the full TV schedule and my top streaming picks below.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Nebraska football TV schedule

The story of the 2025 Nebraska schedule is all about the major tests coming to Lincoln and a brutal finish on the road. We’ll find out what the Cornhuskers are made of when both Michigan and USC visit Memorial Stadium. But the real challenge comes in the final stretch with back-to-back road games at UCLA and Penn State before the Black Friday finale against Iowa.

For me, the path to a successful season is really about surviving November. To help you follow every crucial matchup, here’s the Cornhuskers’ 2025 TV schedule, which I’ll keep updated all season long.

Opponent Day Time (ET)/Result Channel
At Cincinnati Bearcats Thursday, Aug. 28 W 20–17 ESPN
Akron Zips Saturday, Sept. 6 W 68–0 Big Ten Network
Houston Christian Huskies Saturday, Sept. 13 W 59–7 FS1
Michigan Wolverines (#21) Saturday, Sept. 20 L 27–30 CBS, Paramount+ Premium
Michigan State Spartans Saturday, Oct. 4 W 38–27 FS1
At Maryland Terrapins Saturday, Oct. 11 W 34–31 Big Ten Network
At Minnesota Golden Gophers Friday, Oct. 17 L 6–24 FOX
Northwestern Wildcats Saturday, Oct. 25 W 28–21 FS1
USC Trojans (#23) Saturday, Nov. 1 L 17–21 NBC
At UCLA Bruins Saturday, Nov. 8 9:00 p.m. TBA
At Penn State Nittany Lions Saturday, Nov. 22 TBD TBA
Iowa Hawkeyes Friday, Nov. 28 12:00 p.m. CBS

Data effective as of post date. All listed rankings are from the AP Top 25 poll at the time of the matchup.

Best TV plans for watching Nebraska football

Hulu + Live TV
Editorial rating (4/5)
Price:
$88.99–$99.99/mo.
Channels:
95+
Features:
Unlimited DVR storage; includes ESPN+ and Disney+
View Plans for Hulu
Read Hulu + Live TV review

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

For any serious Cornhuskers fan looking to cut the cord, my top recommendation is Hulu + Live TV. I always point college football fans in this direction because it’s the best all-around service, giving you almost every channel you need in one package. I’m talking CBS, Big Ten Network, FOX, ESPN, NBC, and more, plus the unbeatable value of ESPN+ and unlimited DVR storage included.

Unfortunately, any dedicated Big Ten fan knows there’s a wild card in the schedule: Peacock. While Nebraska doesn’t have any games locked into a Peacock-exclusive slot yet, that often changes as the season progresses. That’s why I still consider a Peacock Premium subscription a necessary insurance policy. Starting at $10.99 per month, it’s the only way to guarantee you won’t be left scrambling on game day when a crucial matchup inevitably ends up there.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch Nebraska Cornhuskers football FAQ

Where can I watch Nebraska football for free?

You can watch some Cornhuskers football for free using a digital antenna. It’s a one-time purchase that gets you any game airing on your local CBS, FOX, and NBC stations. For games on premium channels like Big Ten Network, you can use a free trial from a streaming service like DIRECTV or Fubo.

Where can I stream Nebraska games if I don’t have cable?

My top streaming recommendation for Nebraska football is Hulu + Live TV, as it has the best all-around channel lineup for college football fans. But you’ll also need a separate Peacock subscription for its handful of exclusive Big Ten games.

Can I watch Nebraska football on Peacock?

Yes, a Peacock Premium subscription is a must-have for any die-hard Cornhuskers fan. As part of the Big Ten’s TV deal with NBC Sports, several conference games stream exclusively on Peacock each season. This includes all NBC simulcasts and some matchups you won’t find anywhere else.

How do I watch Nebraska football if I live out of state?

The Sea of Red is nationwide, and so is the Nebraska Cornhuskers’ TV coverage. Since all Big Ten games are on national networks like FOX, NBC, and Big Ten Network, your location in the U.S. doesn’t matter. A good live TV service will give you the same access as someone in Lincoln.

Why you should trust us

The Auburn Tigers finished 14th in the SEC last season. Can 2025 be better? Our TV watch guide shows you how to watch every Auburn football game this year.

item.content:encoded:

The Auburn Tigers haven’t had a winning season since 2020, and the new coach Hugh Freeze hasn’t done much to help that since getting hired in 2023.

As I’ve mentioned in previous watch guides, the SEC is a gauntlet that makes other college football leagues look like pee-wee. But no one is breaking out the tiny violins for the Tigers any time soon.

Heading into 2025, Freeze might be on the coaching hot seat. If he can’t get the Tigers to improve, he could be out of a job faster than you can say “hike.”

Auburn’s journey is sure to be full of drama and intrigue. Follow along with the Tigers using my TV watch guide for this season.

item.title: How To Watch Tennessee Volunteers Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Go Vols! Here’s how to watch Tennessee football all season long. Our guide has the complete 2025 TV schedule, channel listings, and our top streaming pick.

The post How To Watch Tennessee Volunteers Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Fresh off a College Football Playoff appearance, excitement is high for University of Tennessee Football. Head coach Josh Heupel returns for his fifth season to lead the Tennessee Volunteers through the demanding Southeastern Conference, where the roar of over 100,000 fans at Neyland Stadium provides one of the nation’s best home-field advantages.

This season, however, presents a new challenge for the Vols. Following their brutal first-round playoff loss to eventual champion Ohio State, the team faces significant turnover, particularly on offense. With a difficult schedule ahead and many new faces in key positions, the big question is whether this Vols roster can replicate last year’s success.

For fans eager to watch Tennessee football all season long, you can expect to find most Vols games airing across ESPN’s suite of channels, including ABC, ESPN+, and SEC Network. In this guide, I’ll break down the full TV schedule and best streaming services so you can watch every Vols matchup with ease.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Tennessee football TV schedule

The Tennessee Volunteers start the 2025 season with the Aflac Kickoff Game against Syracuse in Atlanta on August 30. After returning home for a matchup against East Tennessee State, the Vols face their first major test of the year when they host SEC rival Georgia at Neyland Stadium. This early showdown will set the tone for a demanding conference schedule.

The heart of the Vols’ schedule is a gauntlet of historic rivalries, highlighted by the “Third Saturday in October” on the road against Alabama. The back half of the season also includes tough road trips to Kentucky and Florida, a significant home game against Oklahoma, and the traditional regular-season finale against in-state rival Vanderbilt.

You can find Tennessee Football’s complete TV schedule below, featuring kickoff times and channel listings.

Its plans include the essential channels for watching the Vols, as well as the added value of ESPN+ and unlimited DVR storage at no extra cost. This combination covers the vast majority of matchups, but it’s essential to be aware of Hulu’s limitations.

item.title: How To Watch Syracuse Orange Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
Was last season a fluke for the Syracuse Orange, or a sign of great things to come? Follow everything Syracuse football with this comprehensive TV watch guide.

The post How To Watch Syracuse Orange Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The Syracuse Orange surprised a lot of college football in 2024 under new coach Fran Brown. They finished No. 20 in the Associated Press Top 25 poll, marking the first time they finished a season ranked since 2018.

But things could be drastically different in 2025. Syracuse returns only two starters on offense, and the defense is made up of unproven players. To replicate the success of last season, the Orange will have to play with enough passion and fire to potentially change their mascot to Red.

Follow all the Orange action by using my comprehensive TV watch guide, complete with schedules, some team analysis, and advice on services you’ll need.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Syracuse Orange football TV schedule

Despite the Orange feasting their way to 10 wins in 2024 behind an otherworldly ability to win close games, not many people are picking them to make a run at the ACC title this year. In fact, media picked them to finish 12th—12TH!—in the conference in 2025.

That’s because Syracuse has what’s considered a much tougher schedule in 2025. Four of their opponents are projected to be in the top four of the ACC.

Where can I watch the Syracuse Orange for free?

You can stream Syracuse football games with a DIRECTV free trial, but be aware of local blackouts and games exclusive to other platforms. You can also watch any games airing on your local ABC, CBS, FOX, or NBC station for free with a simple digital antenna.

Where can I stream Syracuse football games if I don’t have cable?

My favorite way to watch the Syracuse Orange without cable is through Hulu + Live TV. The streaming service has every core college football channel, including ESPN+. But you may still need a separate subscription for games exclusive to Peacock (for Big Ten games) or FloFootball (for smaller conferences).

Can I watch Syracuse football on ESPN+?

As of publication, there are no Syracuse Orange football games scheduled to stream on ESPN+. But that may change because the ACC has a broadcast deal with ABC and the ESPN family of networks, and games sometimes get scheduled later that stream on ESPN+.

How do I watch Syracuse Orange football if I live out of state?

For out-of-state fans, most Syracuse football games air nationally, so a good live TV streaming service will have you covered. Of course, some college football matchups have unique broadcast rights. That’s why it’s always best to check the TV schedule above for specific channel information.

Why you should trust us

CableTV.com junior sports writer, Alex Vejar, cross-referenced the official Syracuse football schedule with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Using those details, he selected his viewing recommendations based on channel availability, pricing, and ease of use.
